BDFM 0.0.1

MCMC Routine for Bayesian Dynamic Factor Models

CppBDFM.Rd

CppBDFM is the core C++ function for estimating a linear-Gaussian Bayesain dynamic factor model by MCMC methods using Durbin and Koopman's disturbance smoother. This function may be called directly by advanced users. The only dependencies are the Armadillo (http://arma.sourceforge.net/) linear algebra library for C++ and the packages needed for interfacing with R (Rcpp and RcppArmadillo).

CppBDFM(B, Bp, lam_B, q, nu_q, H, Hp, lam_H, R, nu_r, Y, reps, burn, Loud)

Arguments

B

initial guess for B in transition equation
Bp

prior for B
lam_B

prior tightness for B (additive)
q

initial guess for q in the transition equation
nu_q

prior "degrees of freedom" for inverse-Whishart prior for q (additive, prior scale is fixed so that increasing nu_q shrinks the variance towards zero)
H

initial guess for H in the trasition equation
Hp

prior for H
lam_H

prior tightness for H (additive)
R

initial guess for diagonal elements of R in the transition equation, entered as a vector
nu_r

prior deg. of freedom for elements of R, entered as a vector (additive, prior scale is fixed so that increasing nu_r[j] shrinks the variance of shocks to series j towards zero)
Y

Input data. Data must be scaled and centered prior to estimation if desired.
reps

number of repetitions for MCMC sampling
burn

number of iterations to burn in MCMC sampling
Loud

print status of function during evaluation.

Contents
